channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Word of the Week: The swashbuckling origins and evolution of 'filibuster'
item.description: Sen. Cory Booker's record-breaking Senate speech wasn't technically a filibuster, but it still put the word in focus. Here's what to know about its hi...

item.title: Microsoft turns 50: A look back at everything from the Altair to the Zune
item.description: The company helped launch the software industry and bring a computer to every desktop. Hit products like Windows and the Xbox became household names –...

item.title: Major deal wipes out $30 billion in medical debt. Even backers say it's not enough
item.description: Undue Medical Debt is retiring unpaid medical bills for 20 million people. The debt trading company that owned them is leaving the market.

item.title: The unique genetic change that turned horses into athletic powerhouses
item.description: A new study suggests genetic changes allow horses to produce more energy, while minimizing the toll the energy takes on cells.

item.title: A 'beacon' or a 'roulette'? Chinese America watchers see opportunities and pitfalls
item.description: Some of China's America watchers see opportunities for their country in the United States' retreat from international institutions. Others see distrac...

item.title: South Korean court removes impeached president over martial law declaration
item.description: Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol was removed from office four months after he declared martial law, sending troops into parliament.

item.title: TV's Dr Oz confirmed to lead Medicare and Medicaid
item.description: Oz, who has never held public office, is best known for hosting US daytime TV show The Dr Oz Show.

item.title: South Korea's president has been removed from power: What happens now?
item.description: The constitutional court unanimously upheld the impeachment of Yoon Suk Yeol.

item.title: 4/3: CBS Evening News
item.description: Markets nosedive as fallout from Trump tariff announcement begins; Woman helps bring first hospital in 150 years to majority-Black Louisville neighbor...

item.title: South and Midwest face potentially catastrophic rains and floods while reeling from tornadoes
item.description: Parts of the Midwest and South are facing the possibility torrential rains and life-threatening flash floods on Friday The fresh storms come as many c...

item.title: Celebrations and sorrow as South Korea president removed from office
item.description: South Korea's constitutional court has unanimously voted to uphold the impeachment of president Yoon Suk Yeol.

item.title: 4/3: The Daily Report
item.description: Lindsey Reiser reports on the fallout from the Trump administration's sweeping tariffs, a court hearing in Washington, D.C., over the White House's de...

item.title: Dow plunges more than 1,600 points as stocks recoil from tariff shock
item.description: Nasdaq also sinks more than 1,000 points as investors fret over the potential economic impact of President Trump's latest tariffs.

item.title: Bollywood actor and director Manoj Kumar dies at 87
item.description: Manoj Kumar was best known for his patriotic films in the 1960s and 1970s.

item.title: U.S. tourist lands on forbidden island to give Diet Coke to remote tribe
item.description: A U.S. tourist sneaked onto a highly restricted island carrying a coconut and a can of Diet Coke to a tribe untouched by the modern world, police said...

item.title: Libya expels aid groups accused of 'African' population plot
item.description: The groups, including the UN refugee agency, are accused of trying to change Libya's "demographic composition".

item.title: When heavy rainfall threatens flooding, you can protect yourself. Here’s how
What to know about the severe storms and flash flooding hitting parts of the US
